column2: The Influence of Pharmacogenetics on Fatty Liver Disease in the Wistar and Kyoto Rats: A Combined Transcriptomic and Metabonomic Study

Analysis of liver tissue from rats exposed to orotic acid for 1, 3, and 14 days was performed by DNA microarrays and high resolution 1H NMR spectroscopy based metabonomics of both tissue extracts and intact tissue (n ) 3).

column1: Study Design Type Term Source REF

column2: Griffin JL, Scott J, Nicholson JK.
The influence of pharmacogenetics on fatty liver disease in the wistar and kyoto rats: a combined transcriptomic and metabonomic study.

All animal procedures conformed to Home Office, UK, guidelines for animal welfare. Male Wistar rats (n ) 3 for each time point; control animals fed control diet for the same time period; Charles River UK Ltd.) were fed either standard laboratory chow, or chow supplemented with 1% orotic acid (Sigma Aldrich, UK) ad libitum.5-6 Rats were killed by cervical dislocation at days 0, 1, 3 and 14, and the left lateral lobe of the liver excised. Tissues were snap frozen and stored at -80 Â°C.
column3: Total RNA was extracted by RNA Isolation Kit (Stratagene) from the livers of Wistar rats at day 0 (n ) 3), day 1 and 3 (n ) 2), and day 14 (n ) 3).
column4: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared following the guidelines described by Affymetrix.
column5: Biotinylated cRNA probes was hybridized following the guidelines described by Affymetrix.
column6: GeneChips were scanning following the guidelines described by Affymetrix using Affymetrix Scanner.
column7: CEL were normalized using Affymetrix MAS 5.0 application
column8: Extracts were prepared (n ) 3 for each time point) using an acetonitrile/water extraction procedure as previously described6 and reconstituted in D2O containing 4 mM trisilylpropionic acid (TSP)
column9: Solvent suppressed spectra were acquired for tissue extracts on a 5 mm inverse geometry 1H/broadband probe into 32 k data points, averaged over 128 acquisitions.
column10: Intact tissue ( 10 mg) was examined using a high-resolution magic angle spinning (MAS) probe. Spectra were acquired at a spinning speed of 5000 Hz, and solvent suppressed spectra were averaged over 256 acquisitions.
